result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie Lee Davis Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Pay all mandatory costs and surcahrges by the end of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Obtain and  maintain full time employment, school or combination of both.  Obtain GED or HSED.

Successfully complete anger management.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Lee Davis Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request To Issue Civil Judgment For Restitution Received And Forwarded to  Ali. os

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Successfully complete Anger Management.
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with Froedtert Hospital.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by the end
          of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
     *   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or
          combination of both.
     *   Obtain GED or HSED.
     *   Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
     *   Restitution is set at $0.00.

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit,received and filed

Defendant Willie Lee Davis in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Willie Lee Davis in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  State does not object.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie Lee Davis in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Received discovery and offer. Defense requesting a Final Pretrial and Jury Trial in Branch 21.    All parties are notified that effective March 7, 2016, this case will be assigned to the Honorable Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Jury trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

ADDRESS INFO for Willie Lee Davis Jr
Current: 2425 N 55th St, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 02-07-2016)
Prior: 1802 South 28th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Rachel S., Melissa C., Angela D. and Froedtert Hospital unless for a valid medical reason.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Willie Lee Davis in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Willie Lee Davis in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Willie Lee Davis not in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/25/15 @ 1:30 pm
